titles: Reflections upon George Keith's late advertisement of a meeting to be held by him and his friends, at Turner's-Hall on the eleventh of the fourth month, 1696 to which he saith, William Penn, Thomas Ellwood, George Whitehead, John Penington, and the second days weekly meeting at London, called Quakers, are justly desired to be present, to hear themselves charged, &c.
author: Penington, John, 1655-1710.
publisher: printed by T. Sowle in White-Hart-Court in Grace-Church-street,
notes: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
keywords: Keith, George, 1639?-1716. --  Advertisement of a meeting (about some controversies in religious matters of faith) to be held by George Keith and his friends, at their usual meeting-place in Turners-Hall in Philpot-Lane, London, the eleventh day of the month called June, 1696 --  Early works to 1800.
Society of Friends --  Apologetic works --  Early works to 1800.
